A

actionPerformed(ActionEvent) - Method in class Board
Called everytime JPanel is repainted.
actionPerformed(ActionEvent) - Method in class WelcomeScreen
the actionPerformed method sets the name and theme within the player, as well as begins the game.
answerSubmitted - Variable in class Player
false when user is answering so that the side scroll doesn't keep moving forward.

B

Bargraph - Class in <Unnamed>
Responsible for reading in 2 arrays (3 topics and 3 percentages) and displays them on a bar graph.
Bargraph(String, double[], String[]) - Constructor for class Bargraph
Constructor that sets the attributes of the bargraph.
Board - Class in <Unnamed>
The board is the basis of the whole GUI and will depict the side scroll as well as the background.

C

chatGPT(String) - Static method in class Player
Initializes connection to openAI API, passes the query and saves the response.
checkAnswer(String, String) - Method in class Player
Checks whether the user is correct or not.
clearQA() - Method in class Player
Once the user has submitted an answer, it replaces the question dialogue.
createDataset() - Method in class Bargraph
Creates a dataset to be passed to the bargraph.

D

dialoguePanel - Variable in class Player
conversation with the user is shown
display(double[]) - Method in class Bargraph
Creates frame and displays the bargraph.

E

endMessage() - Method in class Player
Is responsible for creating a queue of correct and wrong answers.
EndScreen - Class in <Unnamed>
The class EndScreen displays the user's results at the very end of the game using a JTable and data from the Player.
EndScreen() - Constructor for class EndScreen
Constructs an EndScreen that transfers the data from the 2D array created in Player to a JTable and displays it for the user to see their gameplay history.

F

frame - Class in <Unnamed>
The runner class.
frame() - Constructor for class frame
 

G

generateQA() - Method in class Player
Checks if user has reached end of the game (if the user has finished 8 questions), displaying EndScreen if they have.
getImage() - Method in class Jib
Getter method for the jib drawing.
getMarker() - Method in class Player
Gets the marker (used to determine whether we need to stop and where we are for dialogue)
getName() - Method in class Player
Gets the user's name.
getPlayer() - Method in class Board
Getter for the backend.
getQuestionReport() - Method in class Player
Gets the 2D Array of questions, user's answers, and whether they were right or not.
getScore() - Method in class Player
Gets the user's score.
getTheme() - Method in class Player
gets the user's theme.

J

Jib - Class in <Unnamed>
Responsible for drawing/creating Jib (the player) in the same location.
Jib() - Constructor for class Jib
The constructor.

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class frame
Method that runs the whole game.
move() - Method in class Board
If answer is not submitted, don't move.

P

paintComponent(Graphics) - Method in class Board
Draws the background and the main character.
Player - Class in <Unnamed>
This class provides all the functionality of the backend.
Player() - Constructor for class Player
constructor, sets name, score, intializes questions, initializes answers, sets marker, initializes questionreport, intializes panels, texts, and fields and sets all formatting.

Q

QAPanel - Variable in class Player
the area where the submit button, the question, and the textfield are shown

S

setName(String) - Method in class Player
Sets the user's name.
setTheme(String) - Method in class Player
Sets the theme the user desires.
setVisible(boolean) - Method in class Player
Sets the frame to be visible or not.

W

WelcomeScreen - Class in <Unnamed>
The class WelcomeScreen introduces the user to the game by asking them to input their name and the theme they desire to be asked questions about.
WelcomeScreen(JFrame) - Constructor for class WelcomeScreen
Constructs the welcome screen and is essentially responsible for all the action and creation inside such an object.
